text: Indigenous Affairs Minister Ken Wyatt says he plans to work closely with aboriginal communities to ensure a voice to parliament works for the whole community, not just the leadership. Minister Wyatt last week said he would be presenting Prime Minister Scott Morrison to host a referendum on constitutional recognition before the next election. However, on Monday the minister faced backlash form the architects of the Uluru Statement from the Heart – which called upon the government to enshrine an Indigenous Voice to Parliament in the constitution – who accused Mr Wyatt of acting unilaterally and creating confusion over the government’s commitment to the voice. “The prime minister made it very clear some time ago it would not be enshrined in the constitution,” Mr Wyatt told Sky News. “I want to take that notion of a voice and work with a co-design model, so we get something that works for our people across the nation, not just to the leadership.
